intro: Stachys cudiensis, commonly known as the Cudi hedge-nettle, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in rocky or dry environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
